results.content:
The instructor explains the content thoroughly and breaks up lectures into reasonable chunks of content.

I have a lot of professional experience with ASP.NET web applications and along with that I learned some of the basics of JQuery, CSS3, and website development. This was about 4 or 5 years ago and the websites I was working with were all developed using old school html tables. I've been developing Win Forms applications for the past couple years or so.

I was looking to refresh my knowledge of web development, learn more about CSS3, modern html coding techniques, as well as new technologies like bootstrap. This course not only has given me everything I need to develop modern websites with responsive and engaging designs, but it has also given me a handful of useful tools that are free and assist greatly in development that I would never have known about.

I am very grateful. This course has really got me up to speed and I feel very confident about my ability to develop modern websites. I'm glad I always have the Vesco website and this course to refer back to if I get stuck.

Thank you very much Irfan Dayan.

results.content:
When we surf the web we occasionally see websites which catch our eye and this is generally because of a piece of animation or something subtle but engaging. This course does just that. Rather than delve into massive jQuery exercises, free tools and libraries are given which reduce the work down to a few lines. In addition, the demonstration website that is built throughout the course contains all the elements with which to build your own eye catching sites.

An excellent well put together course for people with basic knowledge and by example takes you through all the aspects to the finished product.

This course is very likely to be one of your reference courses that you come back to. For example, you need a carousel effect you will remember this course and refer back.

results.content:
This course is Awesome! I really love how he shows you how to create the cool effects you can add to a website and then demonstrates them. I have really learned a lot so far and am eager to continue and finish the course. It is really fun to be able to make your own animated and cool effects for a website.

The only things I feel could be better is that it can be difficult to see what he is typing into the Brackets code editor. The font is too small and dark. If he increased the font a few times and then recorded the video it would go a long way toward being much easier to see. I admit I am viewing on a small screen 15.4" laptop. A bigger screen would help but making the font larger would help those of us who are using smaller screens. Also, some of the brackets plugins have changed a bit and require additional options to be enabled to work correctly. Most notably 'Indent Guides' and 'CSS Color Preview' currently need to be enabled under the View menu in Brackets to work. The teacher could update those videos with that as he probably had recorded those videos prior to those extensions being changed.

Other than those couple of small things, this course is wonderful and I am really glad I purchased it. For those of you wondering whether to get it. I would and glad I did.

results.content:
I gave a different rating to this one after seen other courses but it is still good and recommendable. What makes this one stand out from other courses is its thought-for-professionals approach:
* Using mockup tools, 
* Debugging tips, 
* Focus on good coding practices (use of comments, organization of the html sections, etc).

All by using a single page example to demonstrate the most frequent CSS implementations.

It might be a bit fast when writing CSS properties but it is right to the point.

If you are not only a beginner but aspiring to learn how to code CSS in a more professional way, this course is likely an excellent choice.

I am learning things I didn't learn in the first classes, and he is explaining things in a way that just makes sense. And by using Web tools like inspect, I can see the changes in real time, which clears up any doubt or confusion.

I highly recommend this class if you are a beginner or need to take the info you already learned and see how to actually apply it.

results.content: This is a very useful course which gives immense confidence to develop websites, even for a novice provided they know what html and css is. The whole idea of building a complete website with every small feature is definitely a brilliant one. Instructor's real quick responses for questions asked in dashboard, teaching things around code snippets, emmet plugins were very helpful. Various resources on wireframing tools, icon generators, image websites were also very worthwhile. Only thing which I felt could be made better is to explain why we use these many divs and how do we decide on that. Some generic approach to understand that part would have been helpful. I asked this question in in the forum, but the reply didn't clear off my doubts completely. Likewise when to use # and . in css, would help if such things are explained. Overall, am satisfied with this course and recommend to anyone who'd want to learn to develop websites.  Thanks!

Every section of this course is important, it's extensive but stick with it because it's worth it.

results.content:
I decided to take this course after reading the description, I paid only $10 for this course, but now believe even this to be too much.

The are numerous issues with this course which will lead any potential student to make serious development mistakes within their career.

The course promises the following:

You will see the complete Web Development process from Start to Finish project.

At the end of this course, You will have a great skills set of HTML5, CSS3, JQuery and Bootstrap Framework.

You will learn new ways of coding, tips & tricks and modern best practice to develop a website.

You will be able to Build Modern looking Responsive Website which will look great on all the small & wide screens.

You will learn about CSS3 Media Queries and You will be able to make website perfect for responsive design.

You will get Complete Source Code for real responsive website.
View Curriculum 

Although I believe the instructor has the best intentions, the issues throughout  this course are numerous.

First if like me you think you are getting a good deal with the 13hours of on demand video, then think again. The majority of this course is simply repetition from the instructor. It can become slightly tedious waiting for a lesson to end as the instructor repeats himself over and over again.

This course take the approach of watch and repeat, you don't really learn any of the concepts, you simply learn to reproduce what the instructor is creating.

On further analysis I actually find that most of the bootstrap best practices are not used, especially when we look at the responsive classes.

During the course I contacted the instructor with questions and issue, only to be pointed to the stack overflow forum. This is not what should be expected from a course where you are trying to learn and understand. I found the instructors feedback to be none existent, even to the point of avoidance.

The most interesting point is that by the end of the course you still won't have a responsive website, as there are numerous issues for his techniques working on IOS devices.  When asked bout this I was again passed to stackoverflow.

This is one of the biggest issues that really highlight the problems evident within this package. There are many developers creating fully responsive websites that also include IOS devices, but in this course it is apparently not possible.

I really tried to work though this course to the end, but after realising that the amount of issues would eventually have to be corrected by re creating my entire site, it just seemed like both a wast of valuable time and money.

I will be requesting my money back on this course, and will look for one that does meet the stated curriculum.

Irfan Dayan I'm sure you have the best intentions at heart, but I can only provide an honest opinion of this course.

results.content: I cannot help think that this course could have been completed in less than half of its duration. Regardless of the instructor's whispering tone and unavoidable accent, the content is clear and useful. However, there seem to be a miss conception as to the audiences' knowledge. If the course is meant for those who do not know CSS particularly, then it is not giving any explanation about the CSS usage. If it is meant for those with knowledge of CSS then it would have been very frustrating hearing every step taken for every trivial styling which could have been covered in much quicker pace. Nevertheless, creating the course's website is a reward on its own. The course is also rewarding in terms of the interesting and useful google and bracket's extensions revealed. All in all, it is good course, comprehensive, with some interesting additional information.

results.content: I have been developing information systems for more than 30 years, and for the world wide web for 15 years, focusing primarily on back-end technologies. Recently, I decided to pay more attention to front-end development so I took this course and I found a lot of important and useful tips and tricks. The course is very repetitive and this is good because repetition makes a solid foundation to your knowledge. Nowadays, it is extremely important to know how to build responsive websites and this tutorial provided a big idea, although you will need to continue learning and scaling your experience by taking other courses and practicing. The tutor is well organized, speaks clearly and covers may issues in great detail.

results.content:
Amazing Class, I am learning a lot from it. My html and css skills were quite out of date. I never touched JS before, neither its components like jQuery or frameworks like Bootstrap. Instructor speaks very clear, keeps the focus on the elements that are being handled in a very organized way. I found a lot of new methods and useful resources (i am apx. at 60% of this course so far), but what is most important for me is that i am learning to work in a correct manner by taking an example from the way instructor gives these lessons. 

I have seen a lot of material for design and programming. I am not an expert and i had 0% experience in JS before taking the class, hence, i can still do magic with row css and html only. I would say that in my humble opinion, these course is the best i have seen so far.  

Recommended 100% as for newbies just as for experienced designers!

Programmers, WATCH OUT, to those with no design experience and to whom needs to present an idea with a bit of flavor and colors (my situation), go for it. This is a worthy material. 

Instructor, Great Job ! Keep it Up, make more complexed material in this field for advanced designers in your future courses, I am sure people will love it.

++++++++++++++++++++++
PS: Just Finished the whole class !

Like i said earlier, great material, totally speechless (as per me, all juice is at the end of this class). Like they say, patience is a vertue, take it and you won't regret !

Irfan is a real Master in his field. Hope will see more classes from him in future. Not every instructor has his patience and dedication to deliver such a quality of a class :)

Thanks a lot,
Max
